file_content.text: There! There she is! It's Lord Zash's apprentice. Surely she knows.
She wouldn't tell us if she did.
There! There he is! It's Lord Zash's apprentice. Surely he knows.
He wouldn't tell us if he did.
More prattle. It hurts the ears.
Still, it doesn't hurt to ask, does it?
Kirnon, let it rest.
I will not let it rest. Everyone knows Lord Zash was at the party when Skotia was killed, and yet everyone knows she killed him.
She's somehow devised a way of being in two places at once. If I let it rest, we'll all be dead!
That's why I'll never tell her secrets.
You're right about that.
Good idea. Don't tell him anything, apprentice.
But I must know!
You cowards.
No, of course not. But one must be ever-vigilant on Dromund Kaas so that your enemies don't gain an advantage.
Maybe you shouldn't talk so much, then.
Don't be silly. I'm the one who killed Skotia.
Zash didn't do anything.
Now you're the one who's being silly.
I wouldn't underestimate her, Kirnon. She looks dangerous enough to me.
But a Dark Lord of the Sith! She's only an apprentice, Calaverous.
I wouldn't underestimate him, Kirnon. He looks dangerous enough to me.
But a Dark Lord of the Sith! He's only an apprentice, Calaverous.
Please, you must tell me--how did Zash kill Darth Skotia?
Lord Zash is innocent.
She didn't.
How many times do I have to say it? It was me, me, me, me, me.
I told you--I did it.
Actually, I killed Skotia.
I did it.
Well, first she got a droid, and then a wig....
It's a long story.
Clearly, she's not going to tell you, Kirnon. Let it rest.
Clearly, he's not saying anything, Kirnon. Let it rest.
Fine, then. Fine. But I'm warning you, Calaverous--Lord Zash is becoming too powerful, too quickly.
Since when has anyone in the history of the Sith committed a murder so brazenly, yet make it appear that she was somewhere else the entire time?
It's enough to wake the Emperor, I tell you.
Your complaining is enough to wake the Emperor. We should all be killing our rivals so efficiently as Lord Zash. Isn't that right, apprentice?
You could all learn something from Zash.
Exactly.
And from you, no doubt.
From that insignificant little apprentice? No, I don't think so.
That is Lord Zash's "insignificant little apprentice," Kirnon. I wouldn't put anything past her.
That is Lord Zash's "insignificant little apprentice," Kirnon. I wouldn't put anything past him.
If you'll excuse me, I have to get going.
I must go.
You two have fun arguing about that.
I'll just let you two go.
Fine, then. I'll just have to find out some other way.
These are strange times. Strange times.
